intro: Phlomoides sarawschanica, commonly known as the Sarawak phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and clusters of small, pale blue or purple flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It is often found in moist, open habitats such as forest edges and grasslands.
